programme.title: WTAE 4 The Record
programme.desc: This morning, a local initiative aimed at tackling drug addiction in our communities and providing resources to impacted families.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.sub-title: Finding Adventure: A Gamer Plugs into the Outdoors
programme.desc: Maverick Meyers is a shy 17 year old gamer who spends 8 hours a day on his self-built computer. Kinga meets Maverick in Clermont, Florida to take him out of his comfort zone on an outing he’ll never forget.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Mystery of Maura Murray
programme.desc: Known as one of the first cases of the digital age, Maura Murray's mysterious disappearance continues to confound investigators and internet sleuths.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.sub-title: Weathering the Storm: Couple Faces Historic Tornado on Eve of Wedding
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.sub-title: Wait, What Happened?: The Stinkiest Episode Ever
programme.desc: In what has to be the stinkiest episode we've ever had, Frank Nicotero asks Cincinnati locals wild and wacky news trivia. You'll be glad you can't smell some of these stories.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.sub-title: Finding Adventure: Screens Off, Adventure On!
programme.desc: Camryn Simpson, a 21-year-old student at the University of Pittsburgh and ambassador on social media platforms can’t take time away from her phone. With the help of Kinga, Camryn will log-out of social media and log-in to the outdoors to find adventure.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.sub-title: Sports Town Stories: Burlington Athletes Overcome Obstacles in the Most Vermont of Ways
programme.desc: From a skier who turned her tragedy into the state's biggest charity event, to a cyclist who energizes others with maple syrup, you can't take the "Vermont" out of Burlington athletes.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.sub-title: Stitch: How Food Fuels the Soul
programme.desc: Sharing a meal is a simple act. But it also fosters connection. This episode features a chef chopping down barriers, a coffee shop serving cups of compassion, a supermarket displaying representation on its shelves and much more.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Brazen Heists You Won't Believe
programme.desc: Heists that are so bold, brazen and audacious you have to see them to believe them. But in the world of crime, audacity doesn’t always pay.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero quizzes contestants about real news stories with unreal outcomes to see if they can earn some cash. In "Oddball Olympics," locals learn about a bizarre world record, a middle school shooting star and a super swimming dog.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.sub-title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot: Soccer Pro, DJ Duo, & Hip-Hop Musician Run Down Top Hot Spots
programme.desc: With the help of notable Kansas City locals Matt Besler, Kemet Coleman, and DJs Ice Kole & Joe, we discover a silent disco aboard a KC streetcar, explore The French Market, and make ourselves at home amongst the stars at Garozzo's Italian tavern.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.sub-title: Eat Play Stay: Find Your Beach in Pensacola, FL
programme.desc: In the otherwise pleasant beach town of Pensacola, you can also find racing crabs, big jerks, burgers smashed, and fruity sours. Choose your mood in the oldest city in America!

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Miya Marcano Story
programme.desc: When homesick college student Miya Marcano books a flight to south Florida for the weekend, her family is thrilled. But when the plane lands, Miya is nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.sub-title: Sports Town Stories: Omaha Athletes Seize Opportunity
programme.desc: From a popular new pro volleyball team drawing huge crowds, to a former football pro who now coaches e-sports, these Nebraskan athletes show how to seize the moment.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.sub-title: Local Love: Hopeless Romantic Searches for Fellow Swiftie
programme.desc: Peter’s first love may be Taylor Swift, but he’s ready to let another person in. Who will sweep this Switfy off of his feet and into his very own fairytale?

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Michael Ferrazzani, creator of Ya Mamma’s sauce, challenges the North End born Italian stallion, Chef Kenny Palazzolo, to a true neighborhood duel. Can Michael’s Grandma inspired dish bring down the chef who lives, laughs and cooks Italian?

programme.title: Stitch
programme.sub-title: Stitch: Authors Make the World a Better Place
programme.desc: The best stories can transform us into magical worlds. They can also provide comfort or challenge us to learn new perspectives. This episode highlights authors, librarians and book lovers alike who make the world a better place.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.sub-title: Show Me Milwaukee: Light Up the City
programme.desc: What’s the best way to experience Milwaukee? By boat! Greg gets a kayaking tour from the founder of Support Local MKE, Marleigh Petras, who shows him all the best spots to hit along the Menomonee River.

programme.title: Plate It Picklesburgh
programme.desc: Plate It Picklesburgh

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.sub-title: Wait, What Happened?: Animals Gone Wild
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero asks contestants about real news stories with unreal outcomes to see if they can win cash. In "Animals Gone Wild," locals learn about a lobster diver in a shocking predicament, creatures cruising in cars and a bull in an odd place.

programme.title: Chronicle: Slice of the 'Burgh
programme.desc: (2023) An exploration into what makes Pittsburgh’s pizza scene so special, and the impact pizza shops have on their communities.

programme.title: Chronicle: Legacy of Flight 427
programme.desc: (2024) Recounting the tragedy of US Airways Flight 427 that crashed in Beaver County, and talking with families and first responders 30 years later.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: It's not a Steelers game without the food. Chef Cory Hughes and Chef Les Murphy face off in the kitchen gridiron to see who can score the best Steelers tailgating dishes.

programme.title: Grit of Greenwood
programme.desc: Greenwood was a thriving Black district in Tulsa when, 100 years ago, it was destroyed in less than 24 hours.

programme.title: Chronicle: Legacy of Flight 427
programme.desc: (2024) Recounting the tragedy of US Airways Flight 427 that crashed in Beaver County, and talking with families and first responders 30 years later.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch showcases the feel-good and do-good that make up the fabric of America from inspiring tales of perseverance, to good Samaritans helping neighbors, to trailblazers improving their communities.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Maker Nation

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Makers, crafters and artists square off to create the most iconic art piece that best represents their city. From glass-blowers and chalk artists to metalsmiths and tattooers, see who Host Ashley Adams and the judges will crown the victor.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact visits a summer camp that’s reuniting siblings separated by the foster care system. Plus, a legal expert explains the impact of the Supreme Court taking on more emergency cases. And, a New York farmer brings fresh produce to underserved communities.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Chronicle: Quip Town
programme.desc: (2024) An all-access look at the Aliquippa high school football team's journey to repeat as state champions, from training camp through the season, all while battling numerous obstacles.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: It's not a Steelers game without the food. Chef Cory Hughes and Chef Les Murphy face off in the kitchen gridiron to see who can score the best Steelers tailgating dishes.

programme.title: Chronicle: The Terrible Towel
programme.desc: (2022) As a symbol of Steelers victory, the Terrible Towel has become a sinister sign for other NFL teams. The Towel followed the Steelers from the playoffs through their second Super Bowl win.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.sub-title: Sports Town Stories: Family Drives Pittsburgh Athletes to Excel
programme.desc: From swimmers fueled by loved ones' unconditional support, to basketball and field hockey siblings driving each other toward greatness, see how family and sports are intertwined in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.
